search_term: Find the official pricing page URL for Microsoft To Do (microsoft-todo.com). Only provide the exact URL to the pricing page, not a summary of pricing information.
response_text: Microsoft To Do is included for free with a personal Microsoft Account and does not have a separate pricing page. Here's the closest relevant page discussing its inclusion and availability: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/which-accounts-can-i-use-microsoft-to-do-with-88effe20-db71-43d6-88b4-6c1595f2e62f【3:1†source】.

citations.title: Which accounts can I use Microsoft To Do with?

[](javascript:void(0))

Sign in with Microsoft

Sign in or create an account.

Hello,

Select a different account.

You have multiple accounts

Choose the account you want to sign in with.

Which accounts can I use Microsoft To Do with?
==============================================

### Start emails quickly with Copilot in Outlook

Save time preparing emails with Copilot as your drafting partner.

[Get started](https://copilot.cloud.microsoft/prompts/all?ocid=cmm0nvvxqo1&products%2Fname=Outlook&createdBy=CreatedByAll)

Microsoft To Do is free when you use your personal Microsoft Account, which means Microsoft To Do is available to all Microsoft 365 Family or Personal customers as well. Both free and Microsoft 365-subscribed personal Microsoft Accounts are powered by Exchange Online in the background, so the technical requirements detailed below are naturally met by default.

Common examples of personal Microsoft Accounts are what you use to log in to Skype, Outlook.com or Xbox. You can manage your personal Microsoft Account here:  [https://account.microsoft.com](https://account.microsoft.com/)

You can also use a work or school Microsoft Account, but you'll want to make sure it is supported first. **The following Microsoft 365 suites include the licenses needed to use Microsoft To Do with a work or school account:**

*   Business Essentials
    
*   Business Premium
    
*   Enterprise Firstline F2
    
*   Enterprise E1
    
*   Enterprise E2
    
*   Enterprise E3
    
*   Enterprise E4
    
*   Enterprise E5
    
*   Secure Productive Business
    
*   Secure Productive Enterprise E3
    
*   Secure Productive Enterprise E5
    
*   Education E1
    
*   Education E2
    
*   Education E3
    
*   Education E4
    
*   Education A1
    
*   Education A3
    
*   Education A4
    
*   Education A5
    
*   Microsoft 365 A3
    
*   Microsoft 365 A5
    

**In addition to a valid product license, one of the following versions of Exchange Online is needed for Microsoft To Do to be able to sync user data:**

*   Exchange Online (Plan 1)
    
*   Exchange Online (Plan 2)
    
*   Exchange Essentials
    
*   Exchange Online Kiosk
    
*   Exchange Online Plan 1
    
*   Exchange Online POP
    
*   Exchange Online (P1)
    

**The following account types or subscriptions are not yet supported:**

*   Accounts hosted via on-premises installations of Exchange Server
    
*   Governmental accounts/subscriptions
    
    *   _Exception: Government Community Cloud Moderate accounts can access To Do on the web, Outlook and on the iOS and Android applications_
        
    *   _Government Community Cloud High & Department of Defense accounts can access To Do on the web and from Outlook._
        
*   Microsoft 365 Apps for enterprise or Microsoft 365 Apps for business
    
*   Microsoft 365 DE accounts/subscriptions operated by T-Mobile Systems
    
*   Microsoft 365 China accounts/subscriptions operated by 21Vianet
    

  [![Image 2: Facebook](https://support.microsoft.com/images/Facebook-GrayScale.png)](https://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Foffice%2Fwhich-accounts-can-i-use-microsoft-to-do-with-b0eef0e0-9077-435c-9d65-0fff24e2766e "Share on Facebook")[![Image 3: LinkedIn](https://support.microsoft.com/images/Linkedin-GrayScale.png)](https://linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Foffice%2Fwhich-accounts-can-i-use-microsoft-to-do-with-b0eef0e0-9077-435c-9d65-0fff24e2766e&title=Which%20accounts%20can%20I%20use%20Microsoft%20To%20Do%20with%3F "Share on LinkedIn")[![Image 4: Email](https://support.microsoft.com/images/Mail-GrayScale.png)](mailto://?subject=I%20think%20you%27d%20be%20interested%20in%20this%3A%20Which%20accounts%20can%20I%20use%20Microsoft%20To%20Do%20with%3F&body=Which%20accounts%20can%20I%20use%20Microsoft%20To%20Do%20with%3F%20https%3A%2F%2Fsupport.microsoft.com%2Fen-us%2Foffice%2Fwhich-accounts-can-i-use-microsoft-to-do-with-b0eef0e0-9077-435c-9d65-0fff24e2766e "Share by email")

pricing_data.pricing_notes: Microsoft To Do is free for personal Microsoft Accounts and included in various Microsoft 365 subscription plans.

pricing_tiers.tier_description: Included in various Microsoft 365 plans for work or school accounts.
